intro: Eriogonum congdonii, commonly known as Congdon's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, spiky inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, often greenish or reddish flowers. Its leaves are usually basal and have a rough, hairy texture. Eriogonum congdonii is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
